sentences: Hans Robert Hermann Hickmann (b. Ro√ülau, Germany, May 19, 1908; d. Blandford Forum, England, September 4, 1968) was an eminent German musicologist.
He studied at the University of Berlin, studying with Curt Sachs and Erich von Hornbostel, and graduating in 1934.
Hickmann first investigated Egyptian music in 1932-33, during a visit to the Siwa Oasis, and settled in Egypt in 1933.
He operated a conservatory called Musica Viva, located at 1 Seket el Fadl in downtown Cairo.
